title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.4-5 | 26-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Their presentation to Krishna are not irrelevant.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verses to be discussed and explains how the citizens offered presentations to Krishna out of love and devotion, even though Krishna is self-sufficient.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is always existing as Krishna, as the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Krishna's self-sufficiency, completeness, and eternal existence, contrasting it with the constantly changing condition of beings in the material world.

segments.key_quote: Our identity as the tiny part of Krishna is eternally our identity.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the concept of consciousness, refuting the idea of merging with Krishna, and emphasizes the importance of pure devotional service in offering to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: It is all a sign of pure love and affection between the Lord and the devotee.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna accepts offerings made with pure devotion, emphasizing the loving reciprocation between the Lord and the devotee, and comparing it to offering a lamp to the sun.

segments.key_quote: The Lord is the supreme Father of all living beings.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the relationship between the Lord and devotees as a father-son relationship, explaining that devotees can ask Krishna for their needs, but Krishna will not provide anything that hinders their devotional service, leading to unalloyed devotion and attraction to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: When the heart is purified of all these material misconceptions, and our spiritual consciousness is awakened, then spontaneously we are attracted to Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by explaining that purifying the heart and awakening spiritual consciousness leads to spontaneous attraction to Krishna, his name, form, qualities, and activities, ultimately leading to pure devotional service.
